title: 111_s1327
content: The Act is titled the "Public and Indian Housing Crime and Drug Elimination Program Reauthorization Act of 2009" and amends the Public and Assisted Housing Drug Elimination Act of 1990 by creating the "Public and Indian Housing Crime and Drug Elimination Program." The chapter is titled the "Public and Indian Housing Crime and Drug Elimination Program Act" and any reference to the previous act is now considered a reference to this new act. Eligible activities are outlined in the act. Section 5124(a)(6) of the Public and Indian Housing Crime and Drug Elimination Program Act is amended to specify activities that can be conducted using grants provided under this chapter, including providing access to drug abuse treatment, education on drug use dangers, assisting drug users in discontinuing drug use, and providing after-school activities for youths. The Public and Indian Housing Crime and Drug Elimination Program Act is amended to include activities such as providing after-school activities, capital improvements, and security services to discourage drug use and violent crime among youths. SEC. 4. APPLICATIONS. Section 5125(a) of the Public and Indian Housing Crime and Drug Elimination Program Act is amended to include requirements for receiving a grant, such as submitting a plan and development agreements. Each plan submitted under paragraph (2) for receiving a grant must be developed in coordination with local law enforcement agencies and include an agreement to work cooperatively with the Office of Policy Development and Research. SEC. 5. REPORTS. Section 5127 of the Public and Indian Housing Crime and Drug Elimination Program Act is amended to require a report to Congress on funded program activities and strategies for preventing violent and drug-related crime in low-income housing. The amendment to Section 5127 of the Public and Indian Housing Crime and Drug Elimination Program Act requires a report to Congress on program activities and strategies for preventing crime in low-income housing, including details on research conducted by the Office of Policy Development and Research or grantees, incorporation of strategies into guidance and regulations, and any recommended statutory changes to enhance grant effectiveness. The Public and Indian Housing Crime and Drug Elimination Program Act is amended to include a new section on the Office of Policy Development and Research review and evaluation plan. The Office of Policy Development and Research will review existing research on preventing and reducing violent and drug-related crime in public and low-income housing. A report must be submitted within 180 days of the enactment of the Public and Indian Housing Crime and Drug Elimination Program Reauthorization Act of 2009. The Office of Policy Development and Research will develop an evaluation plan to assess the effectiveness of strategies funded under the Elimination Program Reauthorization Act of 2009. The plan will use rigorous methodology, including random assignment for evaluations. The Office of Policy Development and Research will develop an evaluation plan using rigorous methodology, particularly random assignment, to assess the effectiveness of strategies in preventing and reducing violent and drug-related crime in low-income housing. SEC. 7. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Section 5130 of the Public and Indian Housing Crime and Drug Elimination Program Act is amended to authorize appropriations of $240,000,000 for fiscal year 2010, $250,000,000 for fiscal year 2011, $265,000,000 for fiscal year 2012, $285,000,000 for fiscal year 2013, and $310,000,000 for fiscal year 2014. Additionally, a set-aside of not less than 2 percent of the funds for each fiscal year is designated for the Office of Policy Development and Research.
